titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‘90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became cliché, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends and countless slang terms (AS IF!) and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Almost 30 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:

Almost 30 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School.

So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

show.title: Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde
show.headline: Bigger. Bolder. Blonder.

event.title: <show-title>Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bigger. Bolder. Blonder.
event.description:
Now a rising young lawyer, Elle Woods is about to make partner at her firm, but when she finds out her dog's relatives are being used as cosmetic test subjects, she heads to Washington, D.C. to fight for animal rights.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Hot dog keychain - It looks like the Fourth of July.
  • Pet bandana - Don't forget, your dog's accessories are just as important as yours.
  • Gay dog sticker - Love is love.
  • Snap cup set - Decorate your own Snap cup and always celebrate your little wins.

show.title: Smurfs (2025)
show.headline: Adventure comes out of the blue

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title> <event-type-title>25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Including IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001, only screened at the 2001 Cannes
event.description:
About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE:

Hong Kong, 1962: Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung Chiu-wai) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung Man-yuk) move into neighboring apartments on the same day. Their encounters are formal and polite – until a discovery about their spouses creates an intimate bond between them. At once delicately mannered and visually extravagant, Wong Kar Wai’s IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a masterful evocation of romantic longing and fleeting moments. With its aching musical soundtrack and exquisitely abstract cinematography by Christopher Doyle and Mark Lee Ping-bin, this film has been a major stylistic influence on the past 25 years of cinema.

About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001:

Initially conceived as one-third of a triptych about food, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE was expanded into a stand-alone feature that won immediate recognition as a modern-day classic. Another third – intended as the “dessert,” as Wong Kar Wai has put it – was, until now, only screened during his masterclass at the 2001 Cannes Film Festival. Now available in wide release for the first time, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001 demonstrates the director’s masterful ability to generate palpable atmosphere and striking characterizations on a miniature canvas – with IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE stars Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man Yuk once again providing the sizzling chemistry – evoking the mystery of transient, unexpected connections in the modern city through his inimitable romantic touch.

Plays as part of IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary Edition. In theaters only! (Janus)

posterImage.altText: IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary

show.title: Summer Wars (Subtitled)
show.headline: A timeless epic exploring life in the digital age

event.title: <show-title>Summer Wars (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: A timeless epic exploring life in the digital age
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

Kenji is a shy, part-time moderator for OZ, the virtual reality world that powers everyday life, until pretty and popular Natsuki recruits him to be her fake boyfriend. While posing as an affluent suitor to Natsuki’s family, Kenji finds that a rogue A.I. program has stolen his online identity, and Kenji is accused of hacking OZ and causing real-world catastrophes. As the destruction in OZ throws Natsuki’s family into disarray, Kenji must unite his newfound connections to overcome an impending cyber apocalypse.

Against a backdrop of stunning countryside vistas and virtual spaces bursting with color, SUMMER WARS is a timeless epic that explores life in the digital age from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda (BELLE).

show.title: The Birds
show.headline: Based on Daphne Du Maurier's classic suspense story

event.title: <show-title>The Birds</show-title>
event.headline: Birds befoul Tippi Hedren in Hitchcock’s feathered creature feature!
event.description:
"Birds are not aggressive creatures, Miss. They bring beauty to the world."

"Look! Over there! They’re in the trees! They’re coming!"

In Alfred Hitchcock’s 1963 adaptation of Daphne du Maurier’s short story The Birds, Melanie Daniels (Tippi Hedren), beautiful blonde socialite and incorrigible flirt, follows eligible bachelor Mitch Brenner (Rod Taylor) to his family home in sunny Bodega Bay, California. The stage seems set for Melanie to turn a meet-cute into much more. Still, she must first contend with the judgments and expectations of Mitch’s overbearing mother Lydia (Jessica Tandy) and former flame Annie Hayworth (Suzanne Pleshette). As if that weren’t enough drama, the quaint bayside town is suddenly beset by an avian menace of dizzying proportions. Why are the birds suddenly attacking everyone? How did the birds organize so well across species? What can we learn from them for our unionizing efforts? So many questions, so few answers. Underappreciated in its time, THE BIRDS has gone on to be revered for its subtextual richness, genre-defining tropes, and iconic special effects. But how is it queer? Let’s be honest, birds are queer. We’ve said it once, we’ll say it again: if it’s got feathers and a cloaca, we’re claiming it for the LGBTQ+ crew. Beyond that, the film is replete with queer-coded characters and elements, from the salty old ornithologist to Mitch’s spookily codependent relationship with his mother. Part romcom, part disaster film, part apocalyptic thriller, THE BIRDS is a campy masterpiece perfect for summer viewing during the end of the world. Cheep cheep, my feathered friends, we fly at dawn.

show.title: Tales from the Hood

show.title: House (1985)
show.headline: An inventive spookblast from the creators of FRIDAY THE 13TH

event.title: <show-title>House (1985)</show-title>
event.headline: An inventive spookblast from the creators of FRIDAY THE 13TH.
event.description:
Blending Raimi-esque horror comedy and a story straight out of the Stephen King playbook, HOUSE is a genre rollercoaster unlike any other. Horror novelist and Vietnam vet Roger Cobb moves into a recently-inherited mansion looking to start his next book when he discovers that his new residence is home to a myriad of malevolent spirits, all of whom want him gone by any means necessary. A feast of jaw-dropping practical effects and surprising plot twists, HOUSE delivers the goods as a genuine cult classic in all the best ways.

DCP courtesy of Shout! Factory and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: Pitch Black
show.headline: Worst. Month-long-eclipse. Ever.

event.title: <show-title>Pitch Black</show-title>
event.headline: Get Riddickulous.
event.description:
Twenty years ago, Vin Diesel's most notable role had been the voice of the titular robot in THE IRON GIANT. Then, on February 18, 2000, two films came out in which he played significant parts: the financial drama BOILER ROOM, and David Twohy's sci-fi shocker PITCH BLACK. It was the latter that launched him toward stardom, as his turn in the antihero role of the gravelly-voiced interstellar convict Richard P. Riddick provides PITCH's arresting center.

After a transport spaceship carrying Riddick and other travelers crash-lands on a planet with three suns, the survivors discover that the perpetual daylight is about to be interrupted by a rare eclipse – and that the darkness brings ravenous creatures. Also starring Radha Mitchell, Cole Hauser, and THE THING/THEY LIVE's Keith David, PITCH BLACK became a sleeper hit and spawned a pair of Diesel-starring sequels.

SF: screening in 35mm courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Back to the Beach
show.headline: "A totally NEW WAVE motion picture experience."

event.title: <show-title>Back to the Beach</show-title>
event.headline: A totally NEW WAVE motion picture experience.
event.description:
Life can be hard for a stressed out car salesman in Ohio, even if you have the perfect wife and two children to carry on your legacy. But, when the husband and wife are played by Frankie Avalon and Annette Funicello, the beach will always call them back to its sandy shores. The beach blanket power couple are drawn to California to visit daughter Sandi (Lori Loughlin) on the way to Hawaii and get waylaid to help her sort out her life. The family soon encounters a series of hiccups that keep them in Cali longer than planned, but they have some fun along the way. The band Fishbone stops by to get groovy, Paul Reubens' Pee-wee Herman celebrates on the beach, and we get even more musical with Stevie Ray Vaughan and Dick Dale. All of this with more polka dots than you can shake a surfboard at. BACK TO THE BEACH might not make sense, but dammit it is fun. (Dede Crimmins)

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

show.title: Russ Meyer's Up!
show.headline: If you don't see UP!, you'll feel down!

event.title: <show-title>Russ Meyer's Up!</show-title> <event-type-title>on 35mm</event-type-title>
event.headline: If you don't see UP!, you'll feel down!
event.description:
Trigger warning: This film features scenes of sexual violence.

Adolph Schwartz, a wealthy old Bavarian with a striking resemblance to a certain genocidal dictator, has been murdered in his bubble bath by a mysterious black-gloved killer. Great news, but who did it? And who is the mysterious Margo Winchester, who just so happened to wander into town right after his death? Co-written with his BEYOND THE VALLEY OF THE DOLLS partner and fellow tit man Roger Ebert, RUSS MEYER’S UP! is a deliriously twisted giallo (sort of) that feels like a Tijuana Bible version of a L’il Abner comic strip. (Elizabeth Purchell)

Screening in 35mm

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Crazy Family
show.headline: The nuclear family implodes in Gakuryū Ishii's raging social satire.

event.title: <show-title>The Crazy Family</show-title>
event.headline: The nuclear family implodes in Gakuryū Ishii's raging social satire.
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

THE CRAZY FAMILY comes from Gakuryū Ishii (formerly Sogo Ishii), one of Japan’s leading filmmaking visionaries who aided in the creation of his country’s own cyberpunk movement. Having recently relocated his family from a cramped apartment in Tokyo to a spacious suburban home, Katsuhiko is hellbent on keeping his picture-perfect idea of success alive. But when the new house starts rotting from the inside, Katsuhiko deteriorates with it and his family soon join him in their own descent into madness. Like a termite infestation, this savage slapstick satire gnaws away at the idea of the “perfect family” until the foundation falls through, giving new meaning to the idea of nuclear destruction

DCP courtesy of Error 4444 and the American Genre Film Archive

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Rubber Gun
show.headline: Allan Moyle's incendiary counterculture drama.

event.title: <show-title>The Rubber Gun</show-title>
event.headline: Allan Moyle's incendiary counterculture drama.
event.description:
Charismatic painter Steve (SCANNERS star Stephen Lack) has carved out a reputation as Montreal’s premiere drug connection, trafficking narcotics with a crew of friends (and lovers) living as a makeshift “family” on the fringes of society. But tensions rise when the police catch wind of their latest shipment, and Steve strikes up a friendship with a university student eager to observe the group’s illicit lifestyle for his graduate thesis.

Featuring seven songs by acclaimed Leonard Cohen collaborator Lewis Furey, the directorial debut of Allan Moyle (TIMES SQUARE, PUMP UP THE VOLUME, EMPIRE RECORDS) is an inventive drug drama that set the stage for DRUGSTORE COWBOY, TRAINSPOTTING, and a number of other unflinching films that made waves in subsequent decades.

Restored in 2K by Canadian International Pictures from the original 16mm A/B negatives.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Vice Squad
show.headline: Pure-cut '80s L.A. grime.

event.title: <show-title>Vice Squad</show-title>
event.headline: Pure-cut '80s L.A. grime.
event.description:
Former soap star and crooner Wings Hauser burst onto the exploitation scene with his intense, over-the-top performance as the psychotic killer pimp Ramrod. Seething and ranting, a homicidal twisted nerve, Hauser is incredible. This is his show all the way – he even sings the theme song "Neon Slime!" Along the way, Hauser jumps the fence from villain into full-on monster territory, making VICE SQUAD not only one of the most exciting films you'll ever see, but one of the scariest as well. In this truly grim urban fairytale, a hooker named Princess (Season Hubley) must make it through a long night in a very dark forest (the streets of L.A.) without being gobbled up by the big bad wolf (Hauser), who himself is being chased by the mighty hunter (the LAPD detective who earlier allowed him to escape.) Pure, sleazed-out entertainment.

New DCP courtesy of Rialto Pictures

event.title: <show-title>Summer Wars (Dubbed)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: A timeless epic exploring life in the digital age
event.description:
Presented in an English dub

Kenji is a shy, part-time moderator for OZ, the virtual reality world that powers everyday life, until pretty and popular Natsuki recruits him to be her fake boyfriend. While posing as an affluent suitor to Natsuki’s family, Kenji finds that a rogue A.I. program has stolen his online identity, and Kenji is accused of hacking OZ and causing real-world catastrophes. As the destruction in OZ throws Natsuki’s family into disarray, Kenji must unite his newfound connections to overcome an impending cyber apocalypse.

Against a backdrop of stunning countryside vistas and virtual spaces bursting with color, SUMMER WARS is a timeless epic that explores life in the digital age from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda (BELLE).

eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

show.title: Slither
show.headline: James Gunn's throwback creature future is an all-out assault of gory fun.

event.title: <show-title>Slither</show-title>
event.headline: James Gunn's throwback creature future is an all-out assault of gory fun.
event.description: Eternally indebted to Fred Dekker’s ‘50s-throwback creature feature NIGHT OF THE CREEPS, James Gunn takes his Troma bonafides to a major studio for an all-out assault of gory fun. Hitching a ride on a meteor, an alien parasite transformers town crank Grant Grant (a next-level Michael Rooker) into a grotesque, tentacled supa monster with an army of zombifying space slugs. Can goof-off town sheriff Nathan Fillion save the day? Or will it be his beleaguered wife Elizabeth Banks? One thing’s for sure, seeing this on the big screen in a wildly vivid 35mm print will cure all ills for the week. (Jake Isgar)

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.
